definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To chop or cut into small pieces.
examples: The workers chipped the dead branches into mulch .

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To break small pieces from.
examples: Be careful not to chip the paint.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , dialectal ) To chisel (something), to chisel on (something).
examples: The fitter was chipping and filing a workpiece clamped in his vise.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , dialectal ) To use a chisel .
examples: The fitters were chipping and filing furiously to meet their deadline.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , sports ) To strike or play (the ball or other implement) as a chip shot.
( transitive , sports such as soccer ) To beat (an opposing player) by use of a chip shot, such as by looping the ball over the head of the opposing goalkeeper.
( transitive , cue sports ) To move (a ball) a relatively short distance by means of an oblique contact.
examples: In potting the black, he also managed to chip the red off the side cushion.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , informal ) To fit (an animal) with a microchip .
( transitive , automotive ) To upgrade an engine management system , usually to increase power.
( intransitive , card games , often with "in" ) To ante ( up ).
( UK , transitive , often with "in" ) To contribute .
examples: Everyone needs to chip in £1 for George's leaving collection.

definitions.definition: ( also to chip at ) To make fun of .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To chop or cut into small pieces.

( transitive , cue sports ) To move (a ball) a relatively short distance by means of an oblique contact.
